snippet: The House is expected to vote Wednesday on a plan to reverse a budget cut affecting working-age veterans in exchange for extending the government’s borrowing authority.
abstract: House is likely to vote on a plan to extend the government's borrowing authority into 2015 in exchange for reversing a cut to the pensions of working-age military veterans that Congress approved two months earlier to try to trim the budget deficit.
lead_paragraph: The House is expected to vote Wednesday on a plan to reverse a budget cut affecting working-age veterans in exchange for extending the government’s borrowing authority.

headline.main: House Republicans Seek to Trade Debt Deal for Repeal on Military Pensions
headline.print_headline: House Trade-Off: Debt Deal for Pensions
